title: Knowledge Representation and Reasoning
description: Fundamentals of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning with focus on Prolog programming

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to Knowledge Representation
chapters.description: Introduction to knowledge representation concepts, including declarative knowledge and differences between machine learning and knowledge representation
objectives: Understand basic concepts of knowledge representation
Master the relationship between declarative knowledge and machine learning

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Prolog Fundamentals
chapters.description: Learn Prolog programming fundamentals including facts, rules, queries and variable binding

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Prolog Debugging
chapters.description: Learn Prolog debugging techniques and tracing tools
objectives: Learn to use trace and spy tools

chapters.title: Chapter 4: Prolog Structures and Matching
chapters.description: In-depth study of Prolog syntax, structures, matching algorithms and unification
objectives: Master Prolog atom, number and variable syntax
Understand the concept and representation of structures
Understand the difference between matching and unification

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Prolog Lists, Operators and Arithmetic
chapters.description: Learn Prolog list operations, operator definitions and arithmetic operations
objectives: Learn to define and use operators
Understand the use of arithmetic operations
Be able to write recursive list processing programs

chapters.title: Chapter 6: Prolog Negation and Cut
chapters.description: Learn negation operations and cut operator in Prolog
objectives: Understand the role of cut operator
Master the use of negation as failure
Learn to avoid common negation pitfalls

chapters.title: Chapter 7: Midterm Review
objectives: Review core concepts of knowledge representation
